page.title: 08Hill Farm, Black Mountain
page.content: Charlie's{Hill Farm}of 75 acres is on the slopes of the Black Mountain. Originally his land was fenced but {vandals}were continually stealing the fences so now he does not replace them as wood has become so expensive. The land is mainly rough grazing for his herd of{42 Friesian Crosses and Short {Horns. Sheep}were reared here until the 1970's but as the city grew outwards dogs from the newly built {housing estates}began worrying them. The farmer rises every morning at 06.30 and tends the cows. He leaves the milk tank on the roadside where it is collected by the{Milk Marketing {Board,}then goes home and has breakfast. After that he sterilises the milking equipment.The cows are milked again at 17.00. After having sterilised his dairy equipment,once more his long hard day ends at 20.00.
